ai.summary: A 6.1 km moderate hike in the UK suitable for hikers with some experience. The route features steady elevation changes and varied footing, offering a rewarding day out without technical scrambling.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly grassy, well-defined paths with occasional rocky or uneven sections. Mud is possible after rain, and some stretches may require careful footing on uneven ground.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and daylight hours before starting. Wear sturdy, waterproof hiking boots and dress in layers. Carry a map or GPS, a charged phone, and a whistle. Bring enough water and snacks. Stay on marked trails and be prepared for rapid weather changes; inform someone of your plan and return time.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Map or GPS device, or a fully charged phone
Light rain cover or emergency layer
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (April–October) are typically ideal; winter hikes require additional preparation and experience.

seo.title: Cairngorms Trekking I – 6.1 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Cairngorms Trekking I, a 6.1 km moderate hike in the UK. Read terrain details, safety tips, best seasons, and essential gear for a successful trek.
